    • Method Detail

      • convertStringToClass

        public static <T> T convertStringToClass(String theString,
                                         Class<T> targetType)
                                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Converts a string into the specified class type by assuming a new instance of the class can be constructed with a string argument (e.g. Boolean.Boolean(String), Double.Double(String), etc).
        Parameters:
        theString -
        targetType - The type must have a constructor taking a single string argument to be used with this function
        Returns:
        The newly instantiated object representing the string or null if the construction fails. NOTE: Classes might accept an incorrect argument and return an object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the string to convert is null or empty, or no target type specified

      • getObjectFieldsAsMap

        public static Map<String,Object> getObjectFieldsAsMap(Object object)
        Extracts all fields, including private fields, from the specified object and returns them in a Map.
        See Also:
        Class.getDeclaredFields()
